content: good time mitts finished measurements yarn in photo kraemer yarns perfection 7 25 inches/18 5 cm long this pattern can be used with lighter or heavier 7 inches/ 17 75 cm circumference weight yarns with little or no changes in stitch counts however if you use a different gauge please be sure gauge 1 inch x 1 inch 7 stitches and 9 row your co is divisible by four abbreviations materials co cast on dk yarn approximately 100 yards sts - stitches waste yarn k - knit tapestry needle p - purl stitch marker k1f&b - knit one front and back us size 4 dpns 3 5mm or size needed to match gauge pm - place marker slm - slip marker ©2012 melissa woods www spicyhomemaker com good time mitts instructions round 45 - knit 18 sts remove marker place the following 14 sts onto waste yarn these sts will be used co 36 sts divide stitches evenly among 3 needles for the thumb knit the remaining 18 sts as part of the 12 12 12 join in the round be careful to not twist same round when joining your knitting across the your stitches mark the beginning of the round with a thumb sts pull the first two stitches rather tightly to marker prevent a gap from forming in the hand of your mitt remove all markers and redistribute your live sts evenly cuff over three needles 12 12 12 rounds 1-18 k2 p2 rounds 46-52 - knit all sts rounds 53-64 - k2 p2 body of glove rounds 19-30 - knit all sts bind off using jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind off round 31 - k10 k1f&b pm k1 k11 pm k1f&b thumb k12 you should now have 13 stitches on the first needle 13 stitches on the second needle and 12 stitches transfer 14 sts from the waste yarn to two needles on the last needle the first and second needle will place 8 sts on the first needle and 6 sts on the second continue to increase in stitches while the third needle needle using a third needle pick up 6 sts from the will always have only 12 stitches fabric of the body of the glove for a total of 20 sts place marker to indicate the beginning of the round round 32 - knit all sts round 33 - k11 k1f&b pm k1 k11 pm k1f&b rounds 1-2 - knit all sts k1 k12 rounds 3-10 - k2 p2 repeat *knit 10-12 rounds round 34 - knit all sts depending on your preference* round 35 - k12 k1f&b slm k1 k11 slm k1f&b k2 k12 bind off do not use jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind round 36 - knit all sts off for thumb it makes the thumb hole too large round 37 - k13 k1f&b slm k1 k11 slm k1f&b k3 k12 round 38 - knit all sts round 39 - k14 k1f&b slm k1 k11 slm k1f&b k4 k12 round 40 -
